isis.stitle: VT 275 Engine Service Manual - Engine Electrical Components - Removal - Removing Engine Wiring Harnesses

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury or possible death, disconnect the main battery negative terminal before disconnecting or connecting any electrical components.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, do not tug on any sensor wiring harnesses while trying to remove them. If resistance is felt, find the source of resistance and free any connectors or clips that are caught before proceeding.

note.para: If removing the Glow Plug Harness only, refer to Removal - Glow Plug Harness in this section for further information.
Refer to Removal for location photos of individual components.

step1.para: Disconnect main negative (-) battery cable from battery.
Remove engine sensor wiring harness clamps and anchor points securing the wiring harness to the engine.
Disconnect the CMP sensor electrical connector, located on lower left side of the engine block near front cover.
Disconnect the MAF/IAT sensor electrical connector, located at the end of the air inlet duct assembly.

note.para: If removing the complete wiring harness assembly (sensor and injector), disconnect the IDM ground stud and injectors 2, 4, and 6 at this time. Refer to Removing Injector Wiring Harness in this section for further information.

step1.para: Disconnect the wiring harness from the IDM ground stud.
Disconnect EOT and EOP electrical connectors from their respective sensors located in the center of the oil filter base assembly.
Disconnect the MAT sensor electrical connector, located in the left side of the intake manifold.
Disconnect the ECT sensor electrical connector, located above water pump on the left side of the engine front cover.
Disconnect the left side glow plug harness from the sensor harness. Refer to Removal - Glow Plug Harness.
Disconnect the EGR valve electrical connector from the EGR valve, located directly behind the intake manifold air inlet elbow.
Disconnect the BCS electrical connector, located on the inlet elbow.
Disconnect the MAP sensor electrical connector, located next to air inlet on the front of intake manifold.
Pull back rubber boot covering intake heater nut. Loosen and remove intake heater nut and cable.
Disconnect the alternator power electrical connector and the alternator sensor electrical connection from the alternator.
Disconnect the right side glow plug harness from the sensor harness. Refer to Removal - Glow Plug Harness.

note.para: If removing the complete wiring harness assembly (sensor and injector), disconnect injectors 1, 3, and 5 at this time. Refer to Removing - Injector Wiring Harness in this section for further information.

step1.para: Disconnect the CKP sensor electrical connector located on the right side of the lower front of the engine.
Disconnect air conditioner clutch from the sensor harness.
Disconnect starter motor from the sensor harness.
Disconnect sensor harness connector from the ICP sensor located in the right oil rail.
Disconnect the intake air heater relay. Refer to Removal - Intake Air Heater Relay in this section, for disconnecting the wiring harness.
Disconnect the glow plug relay. Refer to Removal - Glow Plug Relay in this section, for disconnecting the wiring harness.
Disconnect the 8-pin and 12-pin wiring harness connectors.

note.para: Some stripped chassis applications may not require the 8-pin connector.

step1.para: Disconnect three IDM wiring harness connectors and four ECM wiring harness connectors (two for engine and two for chassis) from the ECM/IDM modules.
Carefully lift main harness assembly away from engine.

figure.caption: Disconnecting Injector Wiring Harness from connector

step1.para: Depress snap ring into connector while lifting up to remove wiring harness connector.

note.para: Do not pull snap ring out as it could easily fall into engine valley.

step1.para: Disconnect two connectors from the IDM.
Remove and discard O-rings.

note.para: Use this procedure if you are only removing the glow plug wiring harness. If the glow plug wiring harness is being removed with the engine sensor wiring harness refer to REMOVAL, Glow Plug Wiring Harness, Left and Right Hand Side.

figure.caption: Using the Glow Plug Connector Remover / Installer tool

calloutgroup.callout1: Glow Plug Connector Remover / Installer tool

step1.para: Use the Glow Plug Connector Remover and Installer tool to remove each glow plug connector. See Special Service Tools.
Disconnect the glow plug wiring harness from the engine sensor wiring harness.
Remove and discard O-ring from glow plug connector.
